creator: tdeverdiere@scort.com
text:
As JNIEndpoint call JNIEndpointConnector
method startup(String cmdLine, String stdout, String stderr)
..
        try {
            JNIEndpointConnector.setEndpoint(this);
            StartupThread startup = new StartupThread(cmdLine,this);

it is not possible to extend JNIEndpointConnector. because JNIConnectionHandler 
is not accessible in JNIEndpointConnector.
Moreover JNIEndpointConnector is the class called in server.xml Connector 
className tag.
I could correct the problem if you let me i can rewrite JNIEndpointConnector in 
order to let access to the Handler or protected as for the JNIEndpoint (thanx 
telling me what you think)

I think the problem is resolved in 3.3 ( let me know if you have enough API 
for what you want ).

In j-t-c we'll have a much better solution ( most likely you'll be able to 
customize the class that is called by the JNI code ), and probably few other 
big improvements in the JNI side. But only after 3.3 final is out. 

Please send feedback to tomcat-dev on your experience with jni, maybe patches 
or documentations - it's a difficult area.
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
